intro: Viola alpestris, commonly known as the alpine violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate, violet or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade. Viola alpestris is known for its hardiness and ability to thrive in cold climates, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine displays. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to high-altitude landscapes.
